intro: Osbeckia nepalensis var. nepalensis, commonly known as the Nepal willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan regions of Nepal and northern India. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to lanceolate in shape, with serrated margins. Its flowers are small, clustered in dense inflorescences, and are typically pink or purple in color. Osbeckia nepalensis var. nepalensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous areas with cool climates.
